channel.title: CVE Feed for Secvisogram -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Secvisogram -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-47924|2024-08-03T15:02:36.674Z -- secvisogram -- csaf-validator-lib
item.description: An high privileged attacker may pass crafted arguments to the validate function of csaf-validator-lib of a locally installed Secvisogram in versions < 0.1.0 wich can result in arbitrary code execution and DoS once the users triggers the validation.

item.title: CVE-2022-47925|2024-08-03T15:02:36.563Z -- secvisogram -- csaf-validator-service
item.description: The validate JSON endpoint of the Secvisogram csaf-validator-service in versions < 0.1.0 processes tests with unexpected names. This insufficient input validation of requests by an unauthenticated remote user might lead to a partial DoS of the service. Only the request of the attacker is affected by this vulnerability.
